page.title: 04Marston,Local History
page.content: The name Marston is of Anglo-Saxon derivation from Merston -"Marshtown" and Moretaine or Moretayne is the name of a family of norman origin who lived in Marston in the 14th century. The parish comprised scattered settlements of Pillinge, Wood End, Lower and Upper Shelton and Wootton Green plus a number of farms.From the mid- 19th century half the parish was owned by the Duke of Bedford.Marston saw much expansion along Station Road and around the Rectory and Church yard with the expansion of the Brick industry.Nearby is Millbrook station on the Bedford - Bletchley line and its proximity to the M1 has meant recent pressure for development from commuters.Further growth is at present limited by the lack of sewerage capacity.
